doc.title: JPM APAC Technology - NVDA Asia Takeaways
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/JPM/JPM APAC Technology - NVDA Asia TakeawaysJPM APAC Technology - NVDA Asia Takeaways_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/JPM
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/JPM

passages.text: NVDA - Josh Meyers writes investors felt guidance was light given server shipment bottlenecks as Quanta / Wistron were impacted by AWS GB200- >GB300 pushout, and questioning the extent of GB300 pull forward as Hon Hai has given a strong 2H ramp indication. Asia investors did not forecast any China revenues, thus a limited surprise - Huaqin would be a larger beneficiary if B30A is approved, given are the primary China CSP supplier. Networking revenue strength aligned w/ Innolight beat, as Billy Feng writes benefited from strong 800G switch volumes w/ rising Silicon Photonics adoption. Accton further upside may hinge on potential incremental CSP orders. Wivynn is a potential beneficiary of Sovereign AI, an area of strength, w/ their potential MidEast project. Rubin ramp on schedule would also precipitate a contract signing w/ Hynix, as new HBM4 qualification timing is Nov. Thou no discussion on AI Substrate, raw material shortages; this is a key supply chain focus which benefits Unimicron as gaining share

- NVDA (OW PT S170): Off The Call + Asia Takeaways - Josh Meyers link- Zhongji Innolight (OW PT -> Rmb366): upside margin surprise from Silicon Photonics adoption which can persist - Billy Feng link- Unimicron (OW PT NT$225): HDI progress, price hike talk, AI Substrates competitiveness - Jerry Tsai link- ASPEED: stronger 2H orders, thou constrained by substrate shortage - Albert Hung link- GWC (N PT NT$290): US 12" wafer demand more favorable supply-demand vs global overcapacity - Jimmy Huang link- E Ink (OW PT NT$408): positive on margin outlook, healthy ESL growth - Jerry Tsai link
Use the links below to jump straight to each section:
Detailed Highlights Sector Key Newsflow Full Research Links Corporate Access Earnings Calendar
NVDA (OW PT S170): Off The Call + Asia Takeaways - Josh Meyers link

- Blackwell continues to ramp (S28.1bn revenue), Ultra started shipping. Investors felt was light given 1) server shipment bottlenecks - i.e. Quanta / Wistron impacted by AWS GB200->GB300 pushout 2) extent of GB300 pull-forward as Hon Hai has given a strong 3Q / 4Q ramp indication based on GB300- Zero China revenue in 2Q / 3Q, Jensen remains bullish on China: Huaqin is the key beneficiary if B30A is approved as largest AI server board into China CSPs, especially Tencent, ByteDance and ramping Alibaba. Asia investors did not forecast any China revenues, thus a limited surprise- Networking revenue 40-50% above bogey. Spectrum X up double digits and InfiniBand nearly doubled QoQ. Pressured names as ANET, CLS. Innolight would be a beneficiary as saw a strong 800G switch volumes, and seeing increasing Silicon Photonics adoption. Accton a critical AWS Switch supplier, further upside may hinge on potential incremental CSP orders
- \(\mathbb{S}20\mathrm{bn}\) sovereign AI revenues this year. Wivynn revenue hinges on a MidEast project
- Rubin ramp on schedule would precipitate a contract signing w/ SK Hynix for HBM4 supply; new HBM4 qualification timing Nov.
- No mention of AI Substrate shortage nor T-Glass input supply, which has become a key supply chain focus which benefits Unimicron as gaining share
Zhongji Innolight (OW PT -> Rmb366): upside margin surprise from Silicon Photonics adoption which can persist – Billy Feng link

- 1H higher-than-expected net profit w/elevated GM. Better product mix w/higher 800G volume as price cuts offset by better cost structure, due to increasing SiPh (Silicon Photonics) adoption. We believe Innolight could offer better profitability into FY26 by co-operating w/foundry partners. We revise up GM forecast from 31%->41%, model FY25-27 EPS CAGR FY25-27. CPO substitution is a major concern of investors, but we believe the impact will be beyond FY27. PT -> Rmb366 on one-year fwd 20x P/E

- Silicon Photonics offers better cost, share gain: CPO competition beyond FY27. Adopting SiPh solution could help Innolight 1) avoid current EML laser shortage, maximize 1H share 2) lower cost, improve GM. We estimate SiPh could account for c50% of total 800G transceiver shipments, which is seen in stronger SiPh guidance of TowerSemi, who we believe is a likely provider of foundry service to Innolight.
- CPO substitution a risk among investors: our research suggests not until FY27, after 3.2T solution ramp. In-house SiPh technology could enable an Innolight CPO solution also

- AI HDI showing good signs of progress, potentially a long-term GM driver: Co has converted 70-80% of its HDI lines in Taiwan for the GB200/300 project. Yields at some fabs (particularly in China) are reaching comparable yields w/ peers (likely >80%). Believes GMs can be 15-20% above normal HDI GM 8-12%, thus well above corp avg into 20-30%. Now OPM positive as some Taiwan fabs' yields can still improve. Expects yields to improve for all fabs, co can further expand its share from 20-30% in compute tray and lift AI in HDI mix to 55-60% by year-end FY25

- Price hike talk: price adjustments for to reflect cost hikes (T-Glass) are very achievable, also as utilization rates have show good progress. Does not rule out like-for-like price hikes if s/d dynamics continue to improve, as securing T-Glass is the high priority. Notes supply chfin is still undergoing alternative T-Glass supply sources, but no confirmed results yet

- Confident in LT competitiveness in AI substrates: 2H substrate production could be constrained by raw material supply, claims already achieved meaningful AI GPU share (well over 30% for GPU-only; adding all AI-related products management believes overall share is ~50% as CPU+GPU share is split trending towards majority), leading in ASIC (60-70%). Co appears to have secured a commitment from a strategic customer (NVDA) to double current capacity dedicated to AI GPU, Expects leading ASIC share to be maintained in FY26, as new entrants will find difficulty securing T-Glass supply

- Investog feedback: Ibiden has been generally considered the leader in AI Substrates and other competing vendors for HDI as Unimicron suffered execution issues for years, and thus light positioning. Other corporates throughout the conference have mentioned substrate (even pre-bookings) due to T-Glass shortages and demand as several questions focused on pricing and expansion. HDI yield expansion and share re-gain was also a big focus. Investors are finally revisiting Unimicron, especially given their optimistic guidance on yields; share across HDI, Substrates; pricing; and further expansion

- Stronger than expected 2H orders, thou constrained by substrate shortage. Strength across China, US CSPs; longer BMC production cycle due to substrate shortage. Now guides to flatish 2H which is \(\sim 9\%\) better than our estimates, and order backlog implies above seasonal 1Q26 trend. Margins are tracking favorably w/ higher AST2600 mix

- AST2700 mass production in 2Q26. Due to product design changes, mgmt expects AST2700 to enter mass production by 2Q26 vs expectations 1Q26. Expects to be adopted in new server CPU platforms and also existing platforms. Toned down AST2700 penetration rate to 10-20% vs previous 20-25%, in line w/ our 10-15%
- Shortening BMC product cycle to create a moat. Plans to shorten to 1 year vs 3 years by providing refresh versions thru I/O die upgrades. This can increase customer stickiness

- Gradual ramp of I/O expander, PFR chips. Mgmt guides 300-400k ASIC-based PFR chips shipments, share gains vs FPGAs (field programmable gate arrays). Will bundle I/O w/ AST2700, thus adoption rate could be 10-20% and gradually increase
- Rising BMC adoption in high-end switches. Switch BMC shipments are \(

- TCS forms AI-focused unit and names insider Kapur as head, company memo shows (Reuters)- Panasonic Manufacturing braces for tough 2026 as profit slides further (The Edge Malaysia)- Japan to pour US\)68bn into AI, chips and start-ups in India (The Nation)- Advantech USM-500 Gen 2 Achieves IEC 62443-4-2 Cybersecurity Verification of Conformity (Advantech)- Advantech Announces Next-Gen Robotics Development Kit with NVIDIA Jetson Thor with Holoscan Built In (Advantech)- OpenLight: Integrated photonics startup OpenLight gets \(\)34M\(to design and build faster interconnects for AI chips (siliconAngle)- Broadcom, Nvidia Agree to Cloud Partnership (MT Newswire)

- Semiconductor/SPE -Chinese WFE outlook from SPE manufacturers' perspective- Mio Shikanai (Link)- Korea Relative Value -Congress passes second amendment to Commercial Code; what are the next steps and catalysts? 2H August RV discount update- Jay Kwon (Link)- Telecoms - Back to school: Perils of IRUs- Ranjan Sharma (Link)- Rakuten Group (4755 JP) -Expect gradual net add growth and rising ARPU in mobile business- Junko Yamamura (Link)- Snowflake (SNOW US) -Positive on Longer-Term Trends as Software Sentiment Volatility Represents Wildcard Heading Into Earnings Results- Mark R Murphy (Link)
